com.xhive.util.interfaces
Interface XhiveExternalDataLoaderIf

All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveCSVFileLoaderIf, XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf
public interface XhiveExternalDataLoaderIf

Parent interface of XhiveCSVFileLoaderIf and XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Method Detail

setTargetDocument

void setTargetDocument(Document document,
                       Element element)
Set the document and element of that document to add the loaded relational data to.

Parameters:
document - The document to which the document to be appended to.
element - The element that should serve as direct parent of the new data.

setIgnoreHeader

void setIgnoreHeader(boolean ignoreHeader)
Sets whether the header in the external data should be used to name the columns in the XML Document created. XhiveException.INVALID_INPUT_ERROR is thrown when ignoreHeader is set to true and setHeadersIncl(false) is called in XhiveCSVFileLoaderIf.

Parameters:
ignoreHeader - Indicates whether headers are ignored, default is false.

setRowName

void setRowName(java.lang.String rowName)
Set the row name for the created row in the resulting XML Document. Defaults to "row".

Parameters:
rowName - The name of the row in the resulting XML Document

setColumnNames

void setColumnNames(java.lang.String[] columnNames)
Set the columnNames the created columns in the resulting XML Document. The default names are "column1", "column2" etc.

Parameters:
columnNames - Array of strings with the alternate names for the columns

setIgnoreColumns

void setIgnoreColumns(boolean[] ignoreColumn)
Sets which columns in the external data should be ignored in the resulting XML document

Parameters:
ignoreColumn - Array of booleans indicating which columns should be ignored

setColumn2Attribute

void setColumn2Attribute(boolean[] column2Attribute)
Set which columns should be turned into attributes instead of elements

Parameters:
column2Attribute - Array of booleans indicating which columns should become attributes
